page.title: 13Trade
page.content: {VINEYARDS In 1613 a large house called The Vines stood where the Vineyards shopping centre is now.The house was owned then by the{Petre family.}It later passed into the possession of the{Bullen family}who were descendants of Anne Boleyn one of{Henry VIII's wives. The{Vineyards Shopping Centre, which replaced the house, serves the local{community}with most of its daily needs. There are two banks, a post office, a supermarket and a variety of smaller shops.The local library is situated close to the Shopping Centre as is the refurbished{Parish Hall.}A short walk away is the local fire station.
